caption: The Pandemic meal boxes are fantastic!!!!!
nice food but the sause is not good

Got the snack basket for a client..great presentation in a cute little wicker basket with hinged lid and the food looked fabulous and my client said the food was wonderful... Got the Christmas dinner for my family...seriously, much food and all of it scrumptious, but my sweet tooth loved the brownies...the best I've ever eaten. If you haven't tried a boxed meal from Pierpoints, you're missing a wonderful meal.
Delicious food!!!!
Great food. Nice Nancy 😃
I love how they have switched to offering buy ahead, no/low prep dinners during the pandemic. Just cook throughout the week. So smart. The food of course is really good!
One of my top spots for delicious American food. A favorite evening place of mine. The service here is better than most. The bill was reasonable I would say.
Great food box for the weekend

We dined at Pierpoint Restaraunt Tuesday night with a group of about 25 people. At first glance I was skeptical by the appearance or curbside appeal. They handled our crowd with ease. The owner and Brooke put together a fabulous selection of choices for us. The meat and cheese platter was all of great quality. Salad and appetizers were excellent. Try the duck egg rolls. Amazingly good. For dinner some had steaks which were all cooked to perfection. I as well as many ordered the crab cakes. They were easily the best that I have ever had. I also tried the smoked crab cakes. I'm not a fan of smoked anything but the flavor of these were fantastic. A mild smoke with more of a sherry flavor. Not overpowering at all. Just delicious. I will surely visit the Pierpoint again.

I went to Pierpoint with my daughter the other day as I was looking for a place with classic Baltimore crab cakes that wasn't a "Phillips" or a type of place where you need to use a mallet It turned out to be a cute little place with a surprisingly inventive menu. The crab cakes were indeed yummy. They had a smoked version and a standard. I liked the standard a bit better but the smoked was an interesting twist. We had a pasta dish with pumpkin filling and a gorgonzola sauce which was also interesting but we thought the cheese was a bit overpowering. Service was attentive, atmosphere cozy and the chef does the cooking in an open air setting which I always like.
Best comfort food you'll find in Baltimore. Chef Nancy and her team know what they are doing and will provide you with an unforgettable experience.

Went for a Knife Skills Cooking Class. Chef Longo is a fantastic chef and teacher so her classes are always fun and a great learning experience.  There is so much food everyone has leftovers to take home. P.S.  I blocked the faces of our classmates as I did not have permission to post their picture.
The food was terrible  there was a smell when we walked in. Like old shoes.  An oyster and cod cake were bad. I spit them out. The rock fish was tasteless. Do not go here
Simply the best smoked crab cakes. They do not cut corners on the smoking process. No smoke in a bottle here!

I had no real expectations so I was just open to the experience.🤗 Upon arrival we noticed the restaurant was very cold inside granted, they open in the evenings for dinner, so may be they didn't have time to heat up the space, idk. Cold outside & cold inside, strike 1🙄. As we approach the table to be seated the odor hits me in the face. Strike 2. Mildew mop or dish cloth 🤢🤢 Either the entire restaurant was mopped with a disgusting mop or the tables tops were cleaned with a disgusting dish cloth.🤮 The smell alone was killing my vibe. We hung out trying to ignore the smell. 😷 We ordered wine & appetizers. The wine & appetizers were great. I recommend the duck spring rolls, amazing flavor. Although we ignored the smell there was a group of fruit flys (gnats) that flew around our heads and faces like insects tend to do. I am not sure what the smell and bugs were about but it was highly discouraging.🤔🤨 For dinner I ordered the crab cake special for which this restaurant is known, they made it onto the Food Network. The crab cake special included 1 smoke & 1 traditional crab cake served with fries and brussel sprout slaw. The presentation was okay.😑 The actual food left plenty to be desired. The slaw wasn't even shredded just chunks of brussel sprouts covered in mayonnaise that was a NO for me☹  The crab cakes were okay as well nothing special I've had better. The crab cake were droopy & wet on the inside. We laughed our way through dinner and enjoyed one another's presence as a group. However, this was an experience but not one I will repeat any time soon. First impressions are everything. The staff was pleasant but you cannot convince me that they didn't smell that horrid smell.
A great place to be
The best crab cakes! Food and service are topnotch.
Good place to meet your friends and the food is tasty*😄
Not the most sanitary place. Food was okay.
Always outstanding!
What a gem! Absolutely delicious food but what made it for us was the warmth and service of the staff. We laughed, we learned, we reflected: it was like a family dinner but with fantastic food!
Felt immediately at home, wonderful staff, delicious food! You certainly will not leave there hungry! If I lived near by there’s no question that I would absolutely be a regular!

I had the sincere pleasure of dining at this cozy little restaurant on Sunday, the weekend before the July 4th holiday. My friend and I were dining in from out of town, and we'd just left a line dancing event, and we wanted authentic Maryland seafood, crab cakes to be exact and we found this spot. I will warn you that parking can be difficult in this area, especially during the height of the weekend at peak dining hours. However, we arrived shortly after 7 pm, found a decent space within walking distance of the restaurant, and we were so happy to have chosen this place to come dine. It reminded me of some of my favorite downtown restaurants in Boston. I love that it's literally a little nook in the cut! If the outer facade wasn't painted, "yellow" you would miss it.  First and foremost, when we walked in it felt like we were walking into a family member's home. It’s casual in appearance. The Chef/Owner, Nancy was super nice, and invited us in. She was entertaining a few friends that had just completed dinner and dessert, and they were just chatting as we arrived. She seated us, and gave us menus. Everyone was so nice! We ended up chatting with the other group and that was really nice. We even found out that the owner is friends with someone we line dance with. We ended up ordering the crab cakes and I added steak. The food was delicious. The steak was decent, but the crab cakes made up for the steak. The crab cakes was lumpy and perfect! I loved them! The owner also made us a couple of margaritas that we ordered, and it was so refreshing and good! I can tell this is a neighborhood favorite because, she's been in that location for 30 years. It's definitely a place I will be returning to because, the food was good and the conversation was even better! The owner shared with us, some of her really wonderful life stories. It was so awesome to meet her and talk with her because, she's very active in the community and with mentoring Baltimore's inner city youth through her cooking classes, and she's very passionate about building, improving and sustaining the cultural integrity and history of the City of Baltimore. I just love this is definitely the kind of place "where everybody knows your name...CHEERS!" Check them out the next time you're in downtown Baltimore! I promise you will not be sorry! As one of the previous reviews mentioned, if you’re looking for a spot with a “sleek” appearance and contemporary dining experience, then this is not the place. It feels like home, its a little dated (But who cares, I liked how it looked. She’s been there 30 years and that means more to me.), but the crab cakes and conversation alone is enough to make you come and just hang for a bit!
I TAKE COOKING CLASSES HERE AND ITS NOT ONE OF THE BEST IT IS THEBWAT RESTAURANT EVER
Best. Crabcakes. Ever.  Warm friendly people, too.  They go the extra mile.

After arriving in Baltimore we could not wait to find a restaurant that had a high rating for Maryland crab cakes. At first we checked out recommended places in Fells Point only to find out there would be a 1 hr to 1 1/2 hour wait so after a little research we lucked out and discovered basically a small place a few blocks back in off of the main drag waterfront. At first there were only a few folks dinning and wondered if we had made a mistake. Could my research have failed me? From the outside it just looked like a hole in the wall but we walked in anyway and was probably one of the best meals my wife and I had in quite some time. I had the double crab cakes 1 smoked and 1 traditional, corn chowder, salad... My wife had the soft shell crab which was amazing and do not leave without trying the most luscious bread pudding we have ever had! Do not and I repeat do not judge the book by its cover.
Smoked crab cake to die for.

Really enjoyed our first meal there last night. Outstanding food and the friendliest service. Thank you Nancy and Brooke!  We ordered the crab cakes, eggplant, and cream brûlée.  Each item exceeded our expectations. We live in the neighborhood so plan to go back again and again!
Wonderful food, great service (thanks Brooke) and a nice cosy atmosphere. The lightly smoked crab cakes are special.
Great seafood
Had a great cooking class here.
Excellent food and atmosphere

Pier Point is an anomaly. Tiny place with a whale sized reputation and history. This is the only true place to crab cake. We suggest going half'n'half. One smoked cake and one original recipe. They are the only place to smoke their crab, and it tastes out of this world.
Horrible customer service in person and through the phone
Had a wonderful cooking class here. Really cool spot with great food and ownership.
Fabulous food
I use to work here.
Blown away by the food here. Did not disappoint.
Good grub
WONDERFUL SERVICE AND GREAT MANAGEMENT. FOOD IS COOKED THE WAY YOU ORDER. NANCY LONGO IS A PIONEER IN THE IN BUSINESS. AMEN CLAYTON BUTTS

I went to cooking classes here and was blown away. Chef is knowledgeable and the number of recipes and quantity of food is more than I’ve seen anywhere else. Highly recommended for date night or a holiday gift! Pierpoint is one those hidden gems in Fells Point. Once you fall in love with Nancy’s food, you’ll be hooked.
Great food. The best crab cakes in Baltimore including Nancy's smoked crab cake!
A cozy little French bistro where you feel very at home.  We loved it!

I have often had crab cakes at Pierpoint and they are wonderful. I am shocked that anyone who put crab cakes in their trunk for a several hour drive would even consider writing a poor review!  I wouldn’t eat any crab cakes put in my car for the 1/2 hour drive to my house.  All the food at Pierpoint is always fresh and excellent!  Don’t believe one ridiculous review - go and find out for yourself!

As a frequent guest at Pierpoint - I must take issue with anyone who would post a review about food they have placed in a trunk and then driven with food in the trunk for 2-3 hours.   Sorry.  Must disagree.    The food at Pierpoint is always fresh and an all around great dining experience.   Visit Pierpoint for yourself.  And soon.  It’s a great experience with Chef at your table making sure you are enjoying your meal and making it special.

Excellent Crab Cakes. Also try a cooking class if you can. Chef Nancy is a hometown Baltimore GEM and she shares her knowledge and talents freely and with lots of B'more charm. We go to Pierpoint as often as we can when we are in the area.

In réponse to C Barker's one-star review from 7/6/18: I would imagine *ANY* food placed in a hot car trunk to travel an average of 2-4 hours to New Jersey on a hot/humid Baltimore evening (average temp yesterday 87 degrees F with high humidity) would not have the best result.  I have had Chef Longo's crabcakes in a controlled temperature environment, and they are delicious! Even under hot NYC studio lights they are good. And as for the smell in the restaurant Ms. Barker spoke of: again, it was hot, it was humid, and it is a small space. And it always smells delicious in there!!

I was in the area and saw the good reviews.  Place is cozy and friendly.  I ordered 2 crab cake appetizers to go.  My first hint that this wasn't going to be good was the smell.  The crab cakes smelled like they were cooked in rancid butter on a dirty grill.  Not the aroma I wanted driving back to NJ.  I ended up putting them in the trunk. The second was the size,  at $18 each I expected a larger crab cake, definitely over priced.  Ok,  size doesn't matter but taste does...this crab cake was not good.  I'm not picky,  but want what I pay for and this was not worth the $$ or the bad taste it left. Worse crab cake I've ever eaten.

Best crab cake ever. Apple and cherry wood smoked. Must try if you are in the area. We made a stop just have crab cakes there. Its a cosy place. You can see the owner cooking. Service is excellent. Only recommendation is have more cakes on the plate.

Thank you for helping me celebrate  Mother's day with my wife.  As you can tell she is very pleased with the service and the awesome meal she had (double crab cake one traditional and one smoked. This has been an awesome experience and we will be back.
Nancy Longo and the crew provide an awesome atmosphere and the food is excellent.
I recommend the smoked crabcake!
Have the best crabcakes ever because they are smoked! Made with crushed butter crackers, mayo, Worchester, lemon, mustard, old bay, and parsley! Cooking pan with clarified butter
We so enjoyed the comfortable unpretentious vibe, friendly and professional service and, of course, the delicious crab cakes. Thanks to Chef Longo and our server Danielle!
Everything was delicious. Best crab cakes I’ve ever had.
We had an amazing experience the place was so homey I loved it so much the food was so good the staff and owner were so wonderful and great conversation.
Delicious food created by Chef Nancy Longo in at atmophere that always makes you feel like a welcome guest.

Love, love, love! I have been wanting to come back to Baltimore for years and Pierpont Restaurant was cherry on my sundae or perhaps the crab in my cake! Food fresh and delicious. Chef Nancy could easily be the Patron Saint of Crab Cakes. Everything I tried was delicious. The restaurant, the staff and other clientele were warm and inviting. If I lived here, I could see this being my new favorite go to restaurant.
Outstanding food and service. My wife and I have eaten here four times and have never walked away disappointed.

Certainly the best crab cake I've had in quite a few years. First time I've ever had a smoked crab cake and it was fantastic.  A solid focus on crab without fillers which is regionally sourced. A far cry from larger restaurants churning out pre made Frisbees. Everything fresh and cooked to order.  Desserts made in house and are fantastic.
Attended a wedding that was catered by Nancy Longo and the food was terrible.  The worst food I have ever had at a wedding.  Based on this experience I would not choose to dine at her restaurant.
Good food. Service is quite slow on week nights. It's like it's trying to be fancy but the furnishings show otherwise. In short, for good food but a poor experience, this is the restaurant.
Great food...service a bit on the slow side
Great food, very good service, very Baltimore, cozy
Unique, adult food training, youth food courses.
Wonderful!
Nice people, tasty food but very overpriced for what you get. My wife and I left still hungry after appetizers and main course. Not worth the money spent.

Overall very pleasing experience. They catered to us in a personal way. The food was prepared quickly, yet everything tasted fresh. The crabcakes were really good, and the eggplant cake was on point. Would return again if in the area

Coming from an hour away and experiencing great new people, well worth it! Chef Nancy Longo and Pier Point staff was amazing! Super awesome and sweet people. My husband and I will return! Crab cakes were sooo tasty and how the smoked crab cakes was described was on point! Check these lovely ladies out! It's amazing meeting great new souls, we need more people like the pier point  chefs!!!
YUMMY
Solid live music scene on weekend evenings
Great food and cooking classes
Good food!!!!!😊

My daughter went there for cooking classes and she said that she loved it there and that Chef Nancy taught her wonderful knife skills and she met really nice people she said and she liked the food that she made a lot and i did too
Great cooking class!

My girlfriend and I from Detroit had a great time participating in the Maryland-themed cooking class. The menu involved learning how to make the most amazing smoked crab cakes, Maryland fried chicken, biscuits, gravy, seafood soup (bouillabaisse), and a ton of homemade Berger cookies.  It's not the most wheelchair-friendly place, but they were graciously able to accommodate us.  Nancy is a great teacher and person and I look forward to another class with her.
Amazing chef/owner who takes care in each plate
Incredible smoked crab cakes and rock bass
Cooking Class for kids was very disappointing and poorly organized. My child said he was bored to death and did not get to be challenged much.
